required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Urine Samples and Their Relation to Urinary Tract Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Urine Samples and Their Relation to Urinary Tract Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The aim is to explore the human urine composition and its relation to urine tract infections

primary_outcome.measure: Type of bacteria present in the urine
primary_outcome.description: The different bacteria isolated present in the urine will be identified

arm_group.arm_group_label: Healthy volunteers with no urinary tract infections
arm_group.description: people who don't experience urinary tract infections

arm_group.arm_group_label: Healthy volunteers with urinary tract infections
arm_group.description: people who frequently experience urinary tract infections

arm_group.arm_group_label: Intermittent catheter users with neurogenic bladder
Intermittent catheter users with enlarged prostate

intervention.description: The subjects are asked to give a maximum of 15 urine samples during the study
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy volunteers with no urinary tract infections
Healthy volunteers with urinary tract infections
Intermittent catheter users with neurogenic bladder
Intermittent catheter users with enlarged prostate

study_pop.textblock: The study population consists of danish subjects and will consist of healthy volunteers as well as users of intermittent catheter (neurogenic bladder or enlarged prostate) with and without reoccurring urine tract infections.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Have given written informed consent
2. Be at least 18 years of age and have full legal capacity
3. For the 2 patient populations: Use intermittent catheter on a daily basis due to neurogenic bladder or enlarged prostate and have used IC for at least 2 months
4. For healthy volunteers without UTIs: No diag-nosed UTIs within the last year
5. For healthy volunteers with recurrent UTIs: 3 or more UTIs within the last year or 2 UTIs within the last 6 months (treated with antibiotics)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Be treated for urinary tract infection at time of enrolment
2. May not take prophylactic treatment for urinary tract infections (antibiotics only)
